docs.title: Vector DDL
docs.text:
vector -- Equivalent to vector(2000)

vector(512) -- 512-dimensional vector of float32

vector(float64, 128) -- 128-dimensional vector of float64

docs.title: Create table
docs.text:
CREATE TABLE items (
  host_year INT NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
  embedding vector(3)
);

docs.title: Create column
docs.text:
ALTER TABLE items
ADD COLUMN embedding vector(3);

docs.title: Vector DML
docs.text: This page describes CRUD operations on vectors.

docs.title: Create and insert vector into a table
Read nearest neighbor vectors (Exact)
docs.text:
By using vector distance operators

SELECT * FROM items
ORDER BY embedding <-> '[3,1,2]'
LIMIT 5;

Or, by using vector distance functions

SELECT * FROM items
ORDER BY l2_distance(embedding, '[3, 1, 2]')
LIMIT 5;

The above two statements are equivalent.
